intro: Gnidia ramosa, commonly known as the branched gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are typically followed by small, woody fruits. Gnidia ramosa is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is adapted to dry conditions. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
